locations.name: Pallet Town
locations.description: A small country town, home to Professor Oak's lab.

locations.name: Viridian City
locations.description: The nature-loving city where flowers bloom all year round.

locations.name: Pewter City
locations.description: The stone city that rests at the foot of a great rocky mountain.

locations.name: Cerulean City
locations.description: A beautiful city with flowing water and blooming flowers.

locations.name: Vermilion City
locations.description: The international port town where magnificent boats gather from across the world.

locations.name: Lavender Town
locations.description: A solemn, quiet town. People come to visit their departed Pokémon.

locations.name: Celadon City
locations.description: The city where people of many generations live together. The department store is located here.

locations.name: Saffron City
locations.description: Tall buildings tower overhead. It's the most populous city in all of the Kanto region.

locations.name: Fuchsia City
locations.description: A historic village that has become new.

locations.name: Cinnabar Island
locations.description: A town used to be here until it was swept away by an eruption.

locations.name: Indigo Plateau
locations.description: A plateau where the Pokémon League stands towering above all else.

locations.name: Route 1
locations.description: A calm country road full of greenery.

locations.name: Route 2
locations.description: A path that winds and bends around Viridian Forest.

locations.name: Route 3
locations.description: A grassy road near the mountainside with large fallen rocks all about.

locations.name: Route 4
locations.description: A one-way road down a hill from Mt. Moon that leads to Cerulean City.

locations.name: Route 5
locations.description: A placid sloping road connecting to the Underground Path.

locations.name: Route 6
locations.description: A road linking Saffron City and Vermilion City. There's an entrance to the Underground Path.

locations.name: Route 7
locations.description: A short path connecting Route 8 with the Underground Path.

locations.name: Route 8
locations.description: A short path connecting Route 7 with the Underground Path.

locations.name: Route 9
locations.description: A road that forms a maze crossing a small, rocky mountain.

locations.name: Route 10
locations.description: The route runs along a canal and leads to the cavernous Rock Tunnel.

locations.name: Route 11
locations.description: A meadow filled with Trainers. Diglett’s Cave is found here.

locations.name: Route 12
locations.description: A bridge where fishermen gather. It's also called Silence Bridge.

locations.name: Route 13
locations.description: The mazelike path with a refreshing coastal view.

locations.name: Route 14
locations.description: A pleasant coastal road where the salty breeze blows past the trees.

locations.name: Route 15
locations.description: A long, grassy path stretching east of Fuchsia City.

locations.name: Route 16
locations.description: Links to the north side of Pokémon Road. A route that is always bustling.

locations.name: Route 17
locations.description: Also known as Pokémon Road. A place where trainers and Pokémon can walk together.

locations.name: Route 18
locations.description: Links to the south side of Pokémon Road. A place where Trainers gather, looking to battle.

locations.name: Route 19
locations.description: A popular spot for swimming and sunbathing.

locations.name: Route 20
locations.description: An ocean route separated down the middle by the Seafoam Islands.

locations.name: Route 21
locations.description: A sea path warmed by the volcano on the horizon.

locations.name: Route 22
locations.description: A paved road that leads straight to the Pokémon League.

locations.name: Route 23
locations.description: A mountain path where only the strongest Trainers may pass.

locations.name: Route 24
locations.description: Crosses the waterway via the famous Nugget Bridge, just north of Cerulean City.

locations.name: Route 25
locations.description: A path that winds through the forest and comes out overlooking the sea.

locations.name: Route 26
locations.description: An unimaginably difficult mountain road that gives the impression of a test.

locations.name: Route 27
locations.description: A road that crosses from Johto to the Kanto region, like a new journey.

locations.name: Route 28
locations.description: A vacant and hidden mountain road that continues to Mt. Silver.

locations.name: Professor Oak's Laboratory
locations.description: A Pokémon lab located in Pallet Town that is directed by Professor Samuel Oak.

locations.name: Viridian Forest
locations.description: A deep, shady forest filled with nature and Bug-type Pokémon.

locations.name: Diglett's Cave
locations.description: A tunnel dug by Diglett connecting Vermilion City to Pewter City.

locations.name: Pewter Museum of Science
locations.description: The Pewter Museum of Science hosts a wide range of attractions and exhibits, largely based around space and Fossil exploration.

locations.name: Mt. Moon
locations.description: A mountain where shooting stars are said to fall. It is apparently abundant with fossils.

locations.name: Mt. Moon Square
locations.description: Located in the heights of Mt. Moon is a small, square field where Clefairy are said to perform secret rituals.

locations.name: Cerulean Cave
locations.description: A mysterious cave that is filled with terribly tough Pokémon. It is so dangerous, the Pokémon League is in charge of it.

locations.name: Underground Path (Routes 5-6)
locations.description: An underground path connecting Routes 5 and 6, located directly underneath Saffron City.

locations.name: Underground Path (Routes 7-8)
locations.description: An underground path connecting Routes 7 and 8, located directly underneath Saffron City.

locations.name: S.S. Anne
locations.description: A well-known luxury cruise liner which sails the world, stopping annually in Vermilion City, Kanto.

locations.name: Sea Cottage
locations.description: A small building located on Cerulean Cape and is home to Bill.

locations.name: Rock Tunnel
locations.description: A large natural tunnel. It's pitch black, so a light source is required.

locations.name: Power Plant
locations.description: A large natural tunnel. It's pitch black, so a light source is required.

locations.name: Team Rocket Hideout
locations.description: A secret base built and used by Team Rocket to facilitate and administer their operations.

locations.name: Silph Company
locations.description: A company headquartered in Saffron City that manufacturers many tools, including home appliances.

locations.name: Pokémon Tower
locations.description: A tower that houses the graves of countless Pokémon. Many people visit it daily to pay their respects to the fallen.

locations.name: Safari Zone
locations.description: An amusement park outside Fuchsia City where many rare Pokémon can be observed in the wild. Catch them in a popular game!

locations.name: Seafoam Islands
locations.description: Two small islands lightly floating in the ocean. A shocking cold fills the caverns inside.

locations.name: Pokémon Mansion
locations.description: A decrepit, burned-down mansion on Cinnabar Island. It got its name because a famous Pokémon researcher lived there.

locations.name: Cinnabar Lab
locations.description: A facility on Cinnabar Island where scientists perform various research on Pokémon and fossils.

locations.name: Pokémon League Front Gate
locations.description: Serves as a Gym Badge checkpoint for both Kanto and Johto Trainers who want to participate in the Pokémon League.

locations.name: Victory Road
locations.description: A cave that tests Trainers aiming to reach the Pokémon League at the summit.

locations.name: Tohjo Falls
locations.description: The Tohjo waterfall that links the Kanto and Johto regions.

locations.name: One Island
locations.description: This small town shares a name with the island it resides on. It is home to the Pokémon Network Center, which is run by Celio.

locations.name: Two Island
locations.description: This small town shares a name with the island it resides on. There is a small market that sells exotic goods from the Johto and Hoenn regions.

locations.name: Three Island
locations.description: This small town shares a name with the island it resides on. It is one of the most populous towns in the Sevii Islands.

locations.name: Four Island
locations.description: This small town shares a name with the island it resides on. Lorelei of the Kantonian Elite Four comes from this town.

locations.name: Five Island
locations.description: This small town shares a name with the island it resides on. Five Island is both the smallest town and smallest island in the Sevii Islands.

locations.name: Six Island
locations.description: This small town shares a name with the island it resides on. Many say that the view of the stars over Six Island is amazing.

locations.name: Seven Island
locations.description: This small town shares a name with the island it resides on. Seven Island is the southernmost town in the Sevii Islands, farthest away from mainland Kanto.

locations.name: Treasure Beach
locations.description: A beach south of One Island. Many lost or discarded treasures are found here washed upon the shore.

locations.name: Kindle Road
locations.description: Kindle Road is home to the Ember Spa. The spa is a hot spring where Trainers can relax and heal their Pokémon, and it is said to keep one's face smooth despite their age.

locations.name: Cape Brink
locations.description: A brink on the north end of Two Island, home to an expert on Pokémon moves.

locations.name: Bond Bridge
locations.description: A small bridge that connects Three Island to Berry Forest.

locations.name: Three Isle Port
locations.description: Three Isle Port allows ships and ferries to dock on Three Island. There is a small cave which leads to a Dunsparce nest.

locations.name: Three Isle Path
locations.description: A small cave connecting the Three Isle Port to a Dunsparce nest.

locations.name: Resort Gorgeous
locations.description: A remote island not far from Five Island, home to a resort with the same name.

locations.name: Water Labyrinth
locations.description: A rocky maze over the sea, north of Five Island.

locations.name: Five Isle Meadow
locations.description: A peaceful meadow on the coast of Five Island. A suspicious warehouse can be found here.

locations.name: Memorial Pillar
locations.description: A set of two small islands. The south island serves as a grave site to an Onix that was loved immensely by its Trainer.

locations.name: Outcast Island
locations.description: An island far from the coast of Six Island, which contains an unusual cave.

locations.name: Green Path
locations.description: Two small islands and Pattern Bush are all that is here, as well as a sign advocating environmental friendliness.

locations.name: Water Path
locations.description: A coastal promenade where a Heracross enthusiast can be found.

locations.name: Ruin Valley
locations.description: This area of Six Island is fairly mountainous and many hikers can be found exploring this area. In the center of the valley is the Dotted Hole.

locations.name: Trainer Tower
locations.description: A tower where Trainers can be challenged in a variety of different battle types consecutively over a number of floors to reach the top.

locations.name: Canyon Entrance
locations.description: A small area between the town of Seven Island and Sevault Canyon, serving as a transition between the city and the canyon's rugged landscape.

locations.name: Sevault Canyon
locations.description: As a narrow valley, wedged between the sea, Sevault Canyon has a mix of grassy patches and rugged, arid land. The canyon seems to serve as a training ground for elite Trainers.

locations.name: Tanoby Ruins
locations.description: A collection of seven islands that each contain a ruin. These Ruins have been around for over 1,500 years for reasons unknown.

locations.name: Mt. Ember
locations.description: Supposedly an inactive volcano. However, there are persistent reports that the peak blazes with fire at night.

locations.name: Berry Forest
locations.description: A forest on a small islet off the coast of Three Island. Berries grow wildly in profusion, quickly replenishing those that fall off.

locations.name: Icefall Cave
locations.description: A cave which is covered by water and ice on Four Island. It seems like the end of the cave is connected to the ocean.

locations.name: Rocket Warehouse
locations.description: A suspicious warehouse found in the Five Isle Meadow. Reports suggest this warehouse is used by Team Rocket.

locations.name: Lost Cave
locations.description: A bewildering cave off the coast of Resort Gorgeous. Some curious thrill seekers have never emerged from it.

locations.name: Altering Cave
locations.description: This island has been known by this name since the distant past. No one today knows where it got this name, however.

locations.name: Pattern Bush
locations.description: A lush and bush-like area. In it are patterns where no grass grows. Some study it in the belief that a secret is concealed.

locations.name: Dotted Hole
locations.description: A mysterious, just-discovered ruin from an ancient time. It got its name from the six dots on its door.

locations.name: Tanoby Key
locations.description: A small cave on the middle western part of Sevault Canyon. Inside the cave are various boulders and holes that appear to form a puzzle.

locations.name: Monean Chamber
locations.description: An ancient ruin that is rumored to be home to a peculiar Pokémon. However, so far, the Pokémon remains an unconfirmed rumor.

locations.name: Liptoo Chamber
locations.description: An ancient ruin that is rumored to be home to a peculiar Pokémon. However, so far, the Pokémon remains an unconfirmed rumor.

locations.name: Weepth Chamber
locations.description: An ancient ruin that is rumored to be home to a peculiar Pokémon. However, so far, the Pokémon remains an unconfirmed rumor.

locations.name: Dilford Chamber
locations.description: An ancient ruin that is rumored to be home to a peculiar Pokémon. However, so far, the Pokémon remains an unconfirmed rumor.

locations.name: Scufib Chamber
locations.description: An ancient ruin that is rumored to be home to a peculiar Pokémon. However, so far, the Pokémon remains an unconfirmed rumor.

locations.name: Rixy Chamber
locations.description: An ancient ruin that is rumored to be home to a peculiar Pokémon. However, so far, the Pokémon remains an unconfirmed rumor.

locations.name: Viapois Chamber
locations.description: An ancient ruin that is rumored to be home to a peculiar Pokémon. However, so far, the Pokémon remains an unconfirmed rumor.

locations.name: Navel Rock
locations.description: An island between Four and Five Islands in the Sevii Islands. Ho-Oh and Lugia are rumored to rest here.

locations.name: Birth Island
locations.description: An island near Six and Seven Islands in the Sevii Islands. A strange triangle can be found on this island, believed to have ties with space.
